metadata.name: Calima Edition #1/30
metadata.description:
Title: Calima  
Artist: Savannah0ney  
Location: Lanzarote, Islas Canaria.

'Calima' originates from the Spanish word for haze and is a phenomenon caused by the high hot winds that blow South-west from the Sahara desert across to the Canary Islands. 

Sunlight bounces off airborne sand that floats across the ocean on a warm breeze. The outcome? A sunrise that lights the sky on fire. This image captures only a glimpse of a sunrise that boasted stunning hues of pinks and purples, fiery reds and burnt oranges. It is a sunrise that will be ingrained in my memory for years to come.

As my first collectable edition and foray into NFT photography, this piece will give collectors exclusive early access to future pieces minted onto the blockchain.

License: NFT holder is free to use in advertising, private display and in groups, incl. virtual galleries, documentaries and essays by holder of the NFT as long as creator is credited. Provides no rights to create commercial rights. Copyright remains with creator.
